messageBody:
kk_oop wrote:

> Any suggestions on how to organize test cases? Should they be
> included in production code packages or separated out into their own
> JUnitTest package?

I write about this extensively in _JUnit Recipes_, chapter 3.

> Also, any JUnit book recommendations? I saw JUnit.org lists quite a
> few. The books are so expensive, so I'm looking to just get one good
> basic one for now.

The e-book version of _JUnit Recipes_ is available now for USD 25 at
www.manning.com/rainsberger

> This would include approaches to writing test
> cases and using things like mock objects. I notice a new book is
> coming out soon called JUnit Recipes? Any advance word on that?

Yes, it is an /excellent/ book. :) (Really, it's very good. I'm not just
saying that because I wrote it.)

> Note
> that as of now, I'm not using EJB, XML or any goodies like that. I'm
> just using the basic java.utils API, though some folks in our group
> are also using JMS.

Simply skip those parts of _JUnit Recipes_, then come back to them once
you need them!

Also good ones:

JUnit in Action
Test-Driven Development: By Example

I have been too busy writing a JUnit book to have read the others, so I
can't comment on them. :)
